item.title: SVG

item.title: Testing Typescript
item.description: It’s sort of a pain # Especially when there’s DOM stuff and ESM involved. You would think that in 2022, it would be easy to write tests for your library that uses TS, DOM manipulation, and ESM. Haha, no. 1. Make a new tsconfig file # Yeah, cuz es6 is not 7 years old apparently. Something like this (in tsconfig.callitwhatyouwant.json) { "compilerOptions": { "outDir": "./dist/", "module": "commonjs", // required for tests "target": "es5", "strict": true, "sourceMap": true, "jsx": "react", "lib": [ "es2015", "es2016", "es2017", "dom" ], }, "include": ["src/**/*.
